metadata.title: CVE-2017-13694 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - negligible
metadata.description: The acpi_ps_complete_final_op() function in drivers/acpi/acpica/psobject.cin the Linux kernel through 4.12.9 does not flush the node and node_extcaches and causes a kernel stack dump, which allows local users to obtainsensitive information from kernel memory and bypass the KASLR protectionmechanism (in the kernel through 4.9) via a crafted ACPI table.

criterions.comment: linux package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-raspi, was needs-triage').
linux-aws package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
